basics.name: Mikey Wagner
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Senior Software Engineer with a love for spicy foods, problem solving, and discovering new music.
basics.background: Currently, I work for Network-as-a-Service startup - PacketFabric where I develop client facing products that help push the boundaries of cloud computing. Previously, I delivered a highly collaborative and scaled game for Google where developers could reveal the date for the upcoming Google I/O conference by solving interactive puzzles, and have rapidly architected, implemented, and delivered responsive applications under tight deadlines using Scrum methodologies for companies like Honda, AT&T, Walmart, AWS, Intuit, and more.

highlights: Lead Engineer for the Cloud Router product, optimizing secure connectivity between cloud service providers such as AWS and Google. Played a key role in making Cloud Router the top revenue-generating product for the business
Develop an internal component library using Tailwind and Storybook, promoting consistency, sandboxing, and efficiency across all applications
Architect new projects and refactor legacy codebases, significantly improving maintainability and scalability with Vue3, React, Angular, Docker, Tailwind, and Python
Conduct comprehensive code reviews and mentor junior team members, fostering growth and creating a fun, collaborative environment
Engineered and maintained responsive applications for various Google products, consistently meeting stringent quality standards
Key contributor on the small team that developed and launched the highly acclaimed Collaboration of the Cosmos for Google I/O 2020
Implemented new features ensuring seamless cross-browser functionality, leveraging React, Preact, CSS3, Hugo, and Firebase
Actively participated in code reviews and team growth sessions, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment
Developed interactive and dynamic applications for high-profile clients such as Honda, AT&T, AWS, and Intuit

Leveraged React, Angular, AngularJS, and Vue to deliver engaging user experiences, focusing on best practices, maintainability, documenting processes, and actively participating in code reviews and QA to ensure high standards
Partnered with design teams to quickly architect, implement, and deploy websites for Fortune 100 companies such as Walmart, Publix, and more
Engineered fast and responsive sites using React, JavaScript, C#, Node.js, ASP.NET, Grunt, and PostgreSQL, consistently following best practices and standards
Designed and developed the music staff widget, a draggable/droppable interface in JavaScript and Python, to teach music theory intuitively
Utilized Test-Driven Development (TDD) with Jasmine and Karma for hotfixes, feature implementation, and release documentation
Partnered with a small team of Google developers to develop and test a robust platform, ensuring high-quality performance and user experience
Rapidly built websites and custom WordPress themes for multiple clients
Implemented pixel-perfect and responsive front-end designs based on designer's mockups
Conducted regular maintenance and security updates for existing sites

work.company: Jack's Mannequin / Andrew McMahon in the Wilderness
highlights: Toured internationally, performed live, and released albums on Warner Bros Records
Made appearances on television and radio including the Tonight Show, Conan, Jimmy Kimmel, and KROQ

projects.name: PacketFabric
projects.description: Created innovative tools to automate and simplify the way consumers provision and allocate their networks internally and across all major Cloud Service Providers.
highlights: Built using Vue3, AngularJS, Tailwind-ui, Storybook, Python, PostgreSQL
Innovative networking solutions for provisioning and cloud service integrations

projects.name: Google IO Save the Date
projects.description: A highly interactive and visually exciting game built for Google developers to collaboratively reveal the dates for the upcoming Google I/O event.
highlights: Built using Preact, MobX, Firebase, PixiJS, and TypeScript
Praised by developers on twitter and reddit for being interactive, challenging, and unable to hack

projects.name: AWS AI Game
projects.description: Accomplice teamed up with Accenture to deliver an interactive game that integrated AWSâ€™s machine learning and facial recognition at the 2017 AWS RE:INVENT convention in Las Vegas. Continuously learning from human input, the AI got smarter and smarter as AWS re:Invent went on. With every new player, it picked up new insight and became more skillful. So skillful, in fact, that we had to ultimately tweak the code to make sure it was still fun for participants to play.
highlights: Built using Angular, Amazon Rekognition, and TypeScript
Multi-player game that showcases AWS facial recognition tech
Showcased at AWS convention in Las Vegas

projects.name: Oppia
projects.description: Oppia is an online and open source learning tool that enables anyone to easily create and share interactive activities. These activities, called explorations, simulate a one-on-one conversation with an intelligent tutor. Oppia supports learning by doing. Your exploration can include embedded code editors, dynamic world maps, and many other options for interaction.
highlights: Built using AngularJS, Python, HTML5, jQuery, Bootstrap, Protractor, and Karma
Opensource and highly extensible Ed-Tech platform
Maintained by a small team of Google developers

references.name: Anye Freer
references.quote: Mikey was an Angular developer on my team for about two years, our work encompassed several projects, some with much higher than average complexity. He is truly a pleasure to work with, he always has a positive 'can-do' attitude and if he doesn't know something is not afraid to ask or to research it. He is always willing to pitch in and try something new, even if it's not a true development task. He never takes constructive criticism personally; he's always willing to go back and rework a feature to make it even better, which is of course how we all improve our skills over time. He is very sociable and gets along with just about everybody - he's good with both clients and colleagues which is something I definitely can't say about every developer I've worked with! Mikey is a hard worker and a great person to have on your team and I'd really enjoy working with him again given the opportunity.

references.name: Brook Hutchinson
references.quote: Really enjoyed working with Mikey. His ability to articulate complicated Angular topics was invaluable and his understanding of Git is second to none. Mikey is a true IT Professional. He understands the importance of maintaining a positive, professional attitude in the workplace.
